natural problem: Simplify $(3p^3 - 5p + 6) + (4 - 6p^2 + 2p)$. Express your answer in the form $Ap^3 + Bp^2 + Cp +D$, where $A$, $B$, $C$, and $D$ are numbers (possibly negative).
natural solution: Using the associative property and combining like terms, $(3p^3 - 5p + 6) + (4 - 6p^2 + 2p) = 3p^3 - 6p^2 - 5p + 2p + 6 + 4 = \boxed{3p^3 - 6p^2 - 3p + 10}$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes p :: real and A B C D :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> p. A p = 3 * p powr 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> p. B p = -5 * p"
and h2 : "\<forall> p. C p = 6"
and h3 : "\<forall> p. D p = 4"
and h4 : "\<forall> p. E p = -6 * p powr 2"
and h5 : "\<forall> p. F p = 2 * p"
and h6 : "\<forall> p. A p + B p + C p + D p + E p + F p = 3 * p powr 3 - 6 * p powr 2 - 3 * p + 10"
shows  "\<forall> p. A p + B p + C p + D p + E p + F p = 3 * p powr 3 - 6 * p powr 2 - 3 * p + 10"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(3p^3 - 5p + 6) + (4 - 6p^2 + 2p)$. Express your answer in the form $Ap^3 + Bp^2 + Cp +D$, where $A$, $B$, $C$, and $D$ are numbers (possibly negative). The final Answer is 3p^3 - 6p^2 - 3p + 10
 ### Proof
 Using the associative property and combining like terms, $(3p^3 - 5p + 6) + (4 - 6p^2 + 2p) = 3p^3 - 6p^2 - 5p + 2p + 6 + 4 = \boxed{3p^3 - 6p^2 - 3p + 10}$.
 *)

fixes p :: real and A B C D :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> p. A p = 3 * p powr 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> p. B p = -5 * p"
and h2 : "\<forall> p. C p = 6"
and h3 : "\<forall> p. D p = 4"
and h4 : "\<forall> p. E p = -6 * p powr 2"
and h5 : "\<forall> p. F p = 2 * p"
and h6 : "\<forall> p. A p + B p + C p + D p + E p + F p = 3 * p powr 3 - 6 * p powr 2 - 3 * p + 10"
shows  "\<forall> p. A p + B p + C p + D p + E p + F p = 3 * p powr 3 - 6 * p powr 2 - 3 * p + 10"

  show ?thesis sledgehammer
